verified_bets.raw_pick_text: 🏈NFL Onyx Odds Play Week 3🏈Ja’Marr Chase Over 69.5 Receiving Yards (-122)On DK/FD as well. 🤝Played this yesterday, but it’s still up now so gonna post full writeup.🫡Buy low spot here for Chase with Jo

raw_data.name: Free Ja'Marr Chase  Total Total Receiving Yards Pick
raw_data.description:
🏈NFL Onyx Odds Play Week 3🏈

Ja’Marr Chase Over 69.5 Receiving Yards (-122)

On DK/FD as well. 🤝

Played this yesterday, but it’s still up now so gonna post full writeup.🫡

Buy low spot here for Chase with Joe Burrow OUT. Jake Browning is a serviceable backup in my opinion and I don’t think we will see as big as a drop off in production for Chase as some people might think.

In Sundays’ game after Burrow went down with injury, Chase put up a great line with Browning at QB. He had 10 receptions on 11 targets and 128 receiving yards. Chase had a 34.4% target share with Browning at QB. Chase also accounted for 53% of Brownings passing yards last week. Small sample size, but numbers were ELITE.

He now faces a Vikings defense that runs zone coverage at an 81.2% rate so far this season, which is the third highest in the NFL. Chase has been good vs zone coverage this season as he’s put up 15 receptions and 187 receiving yards vs zone coverage. He’s also had a 32.8% target rate vs zone.

Bengals are currently three point underdogs as well, so setting up for more of a pass heavy game script.

raw_data.name: JoshEngleman Free Expert Pick
raw_data.description:
MLB Top Stacks for Friday, September 19

Today's slate features five pitchers priced at $9000 or higher, with Garrett Crochet clearly standing above the rest. His Top2 pitcher probability nearly doubles that of others in his price range, and his ownership is even more dominant at 40%—no other pitcher exceeds 15%. Tampa Bay's active roster ranks 26th in wRC+ against lefties, and no team walks less than the Rays. This combination makes Crochet nearly impossible to fade.

For those looking to save money on an SP2, Jacob Misiorowski stands out as an attractive option. The Cardinals rank 25th in wRC+ against right-handed pitchers and have the third-lowest ISO in the league in these matchups. At $8000, that's compelling value. While the strikeout upside might be limited, the other factors point strongly in our favor.

For those interested in narrative-driven plays, consider Clayton Kershaw in what could be his final start at Dodgers Stadium. The Giants strike out more frequently against lefties and have managed just an 88 wRC+ against them this season. Emotions will certainly run high for this game, which I believe works to our advantage. At just $7000, Kershaw deserves serious consideration.

structured_bet.raw_text: MLB Top Stacks for Friday, September 19Another day, another series in Coors. This time, we're swappi

raw_data.name: JoshEngleman Free Expert Pick
raw_data.description:
MLB Top Stacks for Friday, September 19

Another day, another series in Coors. This time, we're swapping out the Marlins for the Angels. Much like the past few days, the real problem is pricing. The Angels have the highest Top Stack rate by 2x, which isn't surprising. They're also the Top Value team of the day. The only other option in their range? Their opponents. The Rockies are second in both Top Stack and Top Value. Both teams comprise about 30% of all ownership. This is what happens when the matchup is Mitch Farris vs. Bradley Blalock.

The challenge with today's slate is that once you look beyond the Coors game, everything else looks identical. We have seven teams with a Stack Score in the 4s, plus another at 3.99. If you ignore the Coors game, you can take a few stands and feel confident about your chances if your selected team performs well.

If I'm looking for one team outside of Coors, I'm leaning toward the San Diego Padres this morning. Davis Martin poses no real threat. He surrenders significant power to lefties, which benefits Merrill, Sheets, O'Hearn, Cronenworth, and others. While the Padres haven't displayed as much power against righties as expected this season, they still maintain a 118 wRC+ against them. That's enough for me.

verified_bets.raw_pick_text: 🏈NFL Onyx Odds Play Week 3🏈Ja’Marr Chase Over 69.5 Receiving Yards (-122)On DK/FD as well. 🤝Played this yesterday, but it’s still up now so gonna post full writeup.🫡Buy low spot here for Chase with Jo

raw_data.name: Free Ja'Marr Chase  Total Total Receiving Yards Pick
raw_data.description:
🏈NFL Onyx Odds Play Week 3🏈

Ja’Marr Chase Over 69.5 Receiving Yards (-122)

On DK/FD as well. 🤝

Played this yesterday, but it’s still up now so gonna post full writeup.🫡

Buy low spot here for Chase with Joe Burrow OUT. Jake Browning is a serviceable backup in my opinion and I don’t think we will see as big as a drop off in production for Chase as some people might think.

In Sundays’ game after Burrow went down with injury, Chase put up a great line with Browning at QB. He had 10 receptions on 11 targets and 128 receiving yards. Chase had a 34.4% target share with Browning at QB. Chase also accounted for 53% of Brownings passing yards last week. Small sample size, but numbers were ELITE.

He now faces a Vikings defense that runs zone coverage at an 81.2% rate so far this season, which is the third highest in the NFL. Chase has been good vs zone coverage this season as he’s put up 15 receptions and 187 receiving yards vs zone coverage. He’s also had a 32.8% target rate vs zone.

Bengals are currently three point underdogs as well, so setting up for more of a pass heavy game script.

Another day, another series in Coors. This time, we're swapping out the Marlins for the Angels. Much like the past few days, the real problem is pricing. The Angels have the highest Top Stack rate by 2x, which isn't surprising. They're also the Top Value team of the day. The only other option in their range? Their opponents. The Rockies are second in both Top Stack and Top Value. Both teams comprise about 30% of all ownership. This is what happens when the matchup is Mitch Farris vs. Bradley Blalock.

The challenge with today's slate is that once you look beyond the Coors game, everything else looks identical. We have seven teams with a Stack Score in the 4s, plus another at 3.99. If you ignore the Coors game, you can take a few stands and feel confident about your chances if your selected team performs well.

If I'm looking for one team outside of Coors, I'm leaning toward the San Diego Padres this morning. Davis Martin poses no real threat. He surrenders significant power to lefties, which benefits Merrill, Sheets, O'Hearn, Cronenworth, and others. While the Padres haven't displayed as much power against righties as expected this season, they still maintain a 118 wRC+ against them. That's enough for me.

verified_bets.raw_pick_text: 🏈NFL Onyx Odds Play Week 3🏈Ja’Marr Chase Over 69.5 Receiving Yards (-122)On DK/FD as well. 🤝Played this yesterday, but it’s still up now so gonna post full writeup.🫡Buy low spot here for Chase with Jo

raw_data.name: Free Ja'Marr Chase  Total Total Receiving Yards Pick
raw_data.description:
🏈NFL Onyx Odds Play Week 3🏈

Ja’Marr Chase Over 69.5 Receiving Yards (-122)

On DK/FD as well. 🤝

Played this yesterday, but it’s still up now so gonna post full writeup.🫡

Buy low spot here for Chase with Joe Burrow OUT. Jake Browning is a serviceable backup in my opinion and I don’t think we will see as big as a drop off in production for Chase as some people might think.

In Sundays’ game after Burrow went down with injury, Chase put up a great line with Browning at QB. He had 10 receptions on 11 targets and 128 receiving yards. Chase had a 34.4% target share with Browning at QB. Chase also accounted for 53% of Brownings passing yards last week. Small sample size, but numbers were ELITE.

He now faces a Vikings defense that runs zone coverage at an 81.2% rate so far this season, which is the third highest in the NFL. Chase has been good vs zone coverage this season as he’s put up 15 receptions and 187 receiving yards vs zone coverage. He’s also had a 32.8% target rate vs zone.

Bengals are currently three point underdogs as well, so setting up for more of a pass heavy game script.

raw_data.description:
MLB Top Stacks for Friday, September 19

Today's slate features five pitchers priced at $9000 or higher, with Garrett Crochet clearly standing above the rest. His Top2 pitcher probability nearly doubles that of others in his price range, and his ownership is even more dominant at 40%—no other pitcher exceeds 15%. Tampa Bay's active roster ranks 26th in wRC+ against lefties, and no team walks less than the Rays. This combination makes Crochet nearly impossible to fade.

For those looking to save money on an SP2, Jacob Misiorowski stands out as an attractive option. The Cardinals rank 25th in wRC+ against right-handed pitchers and have the third-lowest ISO in the league in these matchups. At $8000, that's compelling value. While the strikeout upside might be limited, the other factors point strongly in our favor.

For those interested in narrative-driven plays, consider Clayton Kershaw in what could be his final start at Dodgers Stadium. The Giants strike out more frequently against lefties and have managed just an 88 wRC+ against them this season. Emotions will certainly run high for this game, which I believe works to our advantage. At just $7000, Kershaw deserves serious consideration.
